SENT.plain: OBJECTIVE: The pathogenesis of moyamoya disease is unknown
The purpose of this study was to detect proteins associated with the pathogenesis of moyamoya disease
CLINICAL PRESENTATION: Cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) samples from three patients with moyamoya disease and four control patients who had cervical lesions but no intracranial lesion were studied
INTERVENTION: CSF proteins separated by two-dimensional polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis were analyzed with the SWISS-2DPAGE and SWISS-PROT databases
In the CSF samples from all three patients with moyamoya disease, a polypeptide spot (Mr = 12,000, pI = 5.35) was observed
This spot was not evident in samples from the four control patients and has not been reported in the SWISS-2DPAGE and SWISS-PROT databases
CONCLUSION: A CSF protein, which is possibly novel and associated with moyamoya disease, has been detected
The analysis of CSF by two-dimensional polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis may reveal a clue by which the molecular mechanism of moyamoya disease may be elucidated
